    • clickedOnPiece

      public void clickedOnPiece(int x, int y)
      this function fires when a player clicks on a piece.
      Parameters:
      x - the x value of the clicked piece.
      y - the y value of the clicked piece.

    • setActivePlayerPosition

      public void setActivePlayerPosition(Position position)
      sets the active position of the player at turn. If the active position is a legal position.
      Parameters:
      position -

    • checkMove

      public void checkMove(Position curPosition, Position newPosition)
      checks the move to be made. This function is only fired when the player at turn has a active position. If the move is legal, the move is made. If the move is not legal the move is not made and the player at turn needs to make a new move.
      Parameters:
      curPosition - the current position that is the active position of the player( the piece the player wants to move).
      newPosition - the position the player wants to move the piece at the curPosition.

    • gameIsDone

      public void gameIsDone()
      sets the game at done.

    • isGameDone

      public boolean isGameDone()

    • setGameDone

      public void setGameDone(boolean gameEnd)

    • getPositions

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> getPositions()
      returns the current positions of the board.
      Returns:
      the positions of the board.

    • nextMove

      public void nextMove()
      game moves to the next move. This means that the player at turn and the player not at turn switch places.

    • getActiveSide

      public Player.Side getActiveSide()
      Returns the side of the player at turn. If the player at turn plays with black it returns Player.Side.BLACK. If the player at turn plays with white it returns Player.Side.WHITE.
      Returns:
      Player.Side

    • getNotActiveSide

      public Player.Side getNotActiveSide()
      Returns the side of the player not at turn. If the player not at turn plays with black it returns Player.Side.BLACK. If the player not at turn plays with white it returns Player.Side.WHITE.
      Returns:
      Player.Side

    • getPositionKing

      public Position getPositionKing(ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> positions, Player.Side side)
      Returns the position of the king at the desired side. If the param side is Player.Side.WHITE it returns the position of the white king. If the param side is Player.Side.BLACK it returns the position of the black king.
      Parameters:
      positions - positions of the board.
      side - side of the king to be found.
      Returns:

    • isMyKingChecked

      public boolean isMyKingChecked(ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> positions, boolean simulation, Player.Side side)
      Checks if my king is checked If the param side is Player.Side.WHITE it returns the white king is checked. If the param side is Player.Side.BLACK it returns the black king is checked.
      Parameters:
      positions - the positions of the board to be checked.
      simulation - does the function needs to run as a simulation.
      side - side of the king.
      Returns:

    • isMyKingCheckedInNewPosition

      public boolean isMyKingCheckedInNewPosition(ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> positions, Position moveFrom, Position moveTo, Player.Side side)
      Checks if my king(the king at the side) is checked if I move the piece at the position moveFrom to the position moveTo.
      Parameters:
      positions - positions of the board.
      moveFrom - position of the piece to be moved.
      moveTo - position of the piece to be moved to.
      side - side of the king.
      Returns:

    • getMyKingPossibleMoves

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> getMyKingPossibleMoves(ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> positions, Player.Side side)
      Gets the possible moves of the king.
      Parameters:

      side -
      Returns:

    • copyPositions

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> copyPositions(ArrayList<ArrayList<Position>> positions)
      copys to positions and returns a new arraylist of the copy of the positions. This function makes a deep copy.
      Parameters:
      positions - positions to be copied.
      Returns:
